plant.name: Bok Choy
plant.info:
Bok Choy exists since 400 AD in China.

It’s name is derived from the Chinese name “soup spoon” due to the shape of its leaves.

Although it’s known as Chinese green, the vegetable has worked its way into many cuisines around the world, particularly in the Caribbean in the 19th century.

plant.name: Lettuce
plant.info:
Lettuce is a member of the sunflower family.

On average, each American eats 30 pounds of lettuce every year.

Most lettuce sold in the US is grown in California. Lettuce leaves that are darker in color contain more vitamins and minerals than the paler color varieties.
